translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules🔽The sub-chapter on sandals

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pādukāruḷhassa dhammaṁ desenti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū pādukā āruḷhassa dhammaṃ desenti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people wearing sandals. …

original: “Na pādukāruḷhassa agilānassa dhammaṁ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: na pādukā āruḷhassa a gilānassa dhammam desessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”

analyzed: na pādukā āruḷhassa a gilānassa dhammaḥ desetabbo
translated: One should not give a teaching to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca akkantassa vā paṭimukkassa vā omukkassa vā agilānassa dhammaṁ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca akkantassa vā paṭimukkassa vā omukkassa vā agilānassa dhammam deseti āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone wearing sandals, whether they are standing, walking, or sitting, who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if it is unintentional, if he is the first offender,
and if he is insane.🔽The first training rule is finished.
